intro: Alloplectus carpishensis, commonly known as the Carpathian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in woodland or rocky habitats. It has lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, elongated fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
